page.title: 02GENERAL INTRODUCTION CONT'D
page.content: For quite some time, Larbert seems to have been the biggest village in the immediate vicinity. For centuries it had the{parish}church for the area.In 1881, its{population}was 6346, but by 1981, the population had shrunk to 4963, while that of Stenhousemuir, 2617 in 1881,had increased by 1982 to 9417 and is still increasing as a result of private housing developments moving to the N.E. in the direction of the motorway. Stenhousemuir has developed in recent times because of its location,and seems to be becoming a{dormitory}town.Out of 126 parents questioned at a local primary school,only 44 find{employment}in the Stenhousemuir/Larbert area,while 27 worked in Falkirk,6 in Grangemouth and 49 elsewhere _outwith the area.
